017package org.apache.juneau.http.part;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.StringUtils.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
021import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
022
023import java.util.*;
024import java.util.function.*;
025import java.util.stream.*;
026
027import org.apache.http.*;
028import org.apache.http.util.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
034
035/**
036 * An simple list of HTTP parts (form-data, query-parameters, path-parameters).
037 *
038 * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
039 * <p class='bjava'>
040 *    PartList <jv>parts</jv> = PartList
041 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>()
042 *       .append(MyPart.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>))
043 *       .append(<js>"Bar"</js>, ()-&gt;<jsm>getDynamicValueFromSomewhere</jsm>());
044 * </p>
045 *
046 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
047 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestCommonBasics">juneau-rest-common Basics</a>
048 * </ul>
049 */
050@FluentSetters
051public class PartList extends ControlledArrayList<NameValuePair> {
052
053   private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
054
055   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
056   // Static
057   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
058
059   /** Represents no part list in annotations. */
060   public static final class Void extends PartList {
061      private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
062   }
063
064   /**
065    * Instantiates a new part list.
066    *
067    * @return A new part list.
068    */
069   public static PartList create() {
070      return new PartList();
071   }
072
073   /**
074    * Creates a new {@link PartList} initialized with the specified parts.
075    *
076    * @param parts
077    *    The parts to add to the list.
078    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
079    *    <br><jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
080    * @return A new unmodifiable instance, never <jk>null</jk>.
081    */
082   public static PartList of(List<NameValuePair> parts) {
083      return new PartList().append(parts);
084   }
085
086   /**
087    * Creates a new {@link PartList} initialized with the specified parts.
088    *
089    * @param parts
090    *    The parts to add to the list.
091    *    <br><jk>null</jk> entries are ignored.
092    * @return A new unmodifiable instance, never <jk>null</jk>.
093    */
094   public static PartList of(NameValuePair...parts) {
095      return new PartList().append(parts);
096   }
097
098   /**
099    * Creates a new {@link PartList} initialized with the specified name/value pairs.
100    *
101    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
102    * <p class='bjava'>
103    *    PartList <jv>parts</jv> = PartList.<jsm>ofPairs</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, 1, <js>"bar"</js>, <jk>true</jk>);
104    * </p>
105    *
106    * @param pairs
107    *    Initial list of pairs.
108    *    <br>Must be an even number of parameters representing key/value pairs.
109    * @throws RuntimeException If odd number of parameters were specified.
110    * @return A new instance.
111    */
112   public static PartList ofPairs(String... pairs) {
113      PartList x = new PartList();
114      if (pairs == null)
115         pairs = new String[0];
116      if (pairs.length % 2 != 0)
117         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Odd number of parameters passed into PartList.ofPairs()");
118      for (int i = 0; i < pairs.length; i+=2)
119         x.add(BasicPart.of(pairs[i], pairs[i+1]));
120      return x;
121   }
122
123   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
124   // Instance
125   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
126
127   private VarResolver varResolver;
128   boolean caseInsensitive;
129
130   /**
131    * Constructor.
132    */
133   public PartList() {
134      super(false);
135   }
136
137   /**
138    * Copy constructor.
139    *
140    * @param copyFrom The bean to copy.
141    */
142   protected PartList(PartList copyFrom) {
143      super(false, copyFrom);
144      caseInsensitive = copyFrom.caseInsensitive;
145   }
146
147   /**
148    * Makes a copy of this list.
149    *
150    * @return A new copy of this list.
151    */
152   public PartList copy() {
153      return new PartList(this);
154   }
155
156   /**
157    * Adds a collection of default parts.
158    *
159    * <p>
160    * Default parts are set if they're not already in the list.
161    *
162    * @param parts The list of default parts.
163    * @return This object.
164    */
165   public PartList setDefault(List<NameValuePair> parts) {
166      if (parts != null)
167         parts.stream().filter(x -> x != null && ! contains(x.getName())).forEach(this::set);
168      return this;
169   }
170
171   /**
172    * Makes a copy of this list of parts and adds a collection of default parts.
173    *
174    * <p>
175    * Default parts are set if they're not already in the list.
176    *
177    * @param parts The list of default parts.
178    * @return A new list, or the same list if the parts were empty.
179    */
180   public PartList setDefault(NameValuePair...parts) {
181      if (parts != null)
182         setDefault(Arrays.asList(parts));
183      return this;
184   }
185
186   /**
187    * Replaces the first occurrence of the part with the same name.
188    *
189    * @param name The header name.
190    * @param value The header value.
191    * @return This object.
192    */
193   public PartList setDefault(String name, Object value) {
194      return setDefault(createPart(name, value));
195   }
196
197   /**
198    * Replaces the first occurrence of the headers with the same name.
199    *
200    * @param name The header name.
201    * @param value The header value.
202    * @return This object.
203    */
204   public PartList setDefault(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
205      return setDefault(createPart(name, value));
206   }
207
208   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
209   // Properties
210   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
211
212   /**
213    * Allows part values to contain SVL variables.
214    *
215    * <p>
216    * Resolves variables in part values when using the following methods:
217    * <ul>
218    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Object) append(String,Object)}
219    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Supplier) append(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
220    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Object) prepend(String,Object)}
221    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Supplier) prepend(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
222    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Object) set(String,Object)}
223    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Supplier) set(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
224    * </ul>
225    *
226    * <p>
227    * Uses {@link VarResolver#DEFAULT} to resolve variables.
228    *
229    * @return This object.
230    */
231   public PartList resolving() {
232      return resolving(VarResolver.DEFAULT);
233   }
234
235   /**
236    * Allows part values to contain SVL variables.
237    *
238    * <p>
239    * Resolves variables in part values when using the following methods:
240    * <ul>
241    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Object) append(String,Object)}
242    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #append(String, Supplier) append(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
243    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Object) prepend(String,Object)}
244    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #prepend(String, Supplier) prepend(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
245    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Object) set(String,Object)}
246    *    <li class='jm'>{@link #set(String, Supplier) set(String,Supplier&lt;?&gt;)}
247    * </ul>
248    *
249    * @param varResolver The variable resolver to use for resolving variables.
250    * @return This object.
251    */
252   public PartList resolving(VarResolver varResolver) {
253      assertModifiable();
254      this.varResolver = varResolver;
255      return this;
256   }
257
258   /**
259    * Specifies that the parts in this list should be treated as case-sensitive.
260    *
261    * <p>
262    * The default behavior is case-sensitive.
263    *
264    * @param value The new value for this setting.
265    * @return This object.
266    */
267   public PartList caseInsensitive(boolean value) {
268      assertModifiable();
269      caseInsensitive = value;
270      return this;
271   }
272
273   /**
274    * Adds the specified part to the end of the parts in this list.
275    *
276    * @param value The part to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
277    * @return This object.
278    */
279   @FluentSetter
280   public PartList append(NameValuePair value) {
281      if (value != null)
282         add(value);
283      return this;
284   }
285
286   /**
287    * Appends the specified part to the end of this list.
288    *
289    * <p>
290    * The part is added as a {@link BasicPart}.
291    *
292    * @param name The part name.
293    * @param value The part value.
294    * @return This object.
295    */
296   public PartList append(String name, Object value) {
297      return append(createPart(name, value));
298   }
299
300   /**
301    * Appends the specified part to the end of this list using a value supplier.
302    *
303    * <p>
304    * The part is added as a {@link BasicPart}.
305    *
306    * <p>
307    * Value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link BasicPart#getValue()}.
308    *
309    * @param name The part name.
310    * @param value The part value supplier.
311    * @return This object.
312    */
313   public PartList append(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
314      return append(createPart(name, value));
315   }
316
317   /**
318    * Adds the specified parts to the end of the parts in this list.
319    *
320    * @param values The parts to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
321    * @return This object.
322    */
323   @FluentSetter
324   public PartList append(NameValuePair...values) {
325      if (values != null)
326            for (NameValuePair value : values)
327                append(value);
328      return this;
329   }
330
331   /**
332    * Adds the specified parts to the end of the parts in this list.
333    *
334    * @param values The parts to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
335    * @return This object.
336    */
337   @FluentSetter
338   public PartList append(List<NameValuePair> values) {
339      if (values != null)
340         values.forEach(this::append);
341      return this;
342   }
343
344   /**
345    * Adds the specified part to the beginning of the parts in this list.
346    *
347    * @param value The part to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
348    * @return This object.
349    */
350   @FluentSetter
351   public PartList prepend(NameValuePair value) {
352      if (value != null)
353         add(0, value);
354      return this;
355   }
356
357   /**
358    * Appends the specified part to the beginning of this list.
359    *
360    * <p>
361    * The part is added as a {@link BasicPart}.
362    *
363    * @param name The part name.
364    * @param value The part value.
365    * @return This object.
366    */
367   public PartList prepend(String name, Object value) {
368      return prepend(createPart(name, value));
369   }
370
371   /**
372    * Appends the specified part to the beginning of this list using a value supplier.
373    *
374    * <p>
375    * The part is added as a {@link BasicPart}.
376    *
377    * <p>
378    * Value is re-evaluated on each call to {@link BasicPart#getValue()}.
379    *
380    * @param name The part name.
381    * @param value The part value supplier.
382    * @return This object.
383    */
384   public PartList prepend(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
385      return prepend(createPart(name, value));
386   }
387
388   /**
389    * Adds the specified parts to the beginning of the parts in this list.
390    *
391    * @param values The parts to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
392    * @return This object.
393    */
394   @FluentSetter
395   public PartList prepend(NameValuePair...values) {
396      if (values != null)
397         prepend(alist(values));
398      return this;
399   }
400
401   /**
402    * Adds the specified parts to the beginning of the parts in this list.
403    *
404    * @param values The parts to add.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
405    * @return This object.
406    */
407   @FluentSetter
408   public PartList prepend(List<NameValuePair> values) {
409      if (values != null)
410         addAll(0, values);
411      return this;
412   }
413
414   /**
415    * Removes the specified part from this list.
416    *
417    * @param value The part to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
418    * @return This object.
419    */
420   @FluentSetter
421   public PartList remove(NameValuePair value) {
422      if (value != null)
423         removeIf(x -> eq(x.getName(), value.getName()) && eq(x.getValue(), value.getValue()));
424      return this;
425   }
426
427   /**
428    * Removes the specified parts from this list.
429    *
430    * @param values The parts to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
431    * @return This object.
432    */
433   @FluentSetter
434   public PartList remove(NameValuePair...values) {
435      for (NameValuePair value : values)
436            remove(value);
437      return this;
438   }
439
440   /**
441    * Removes the specified parts from this list.
442    *
443    * @param values The parts to remove.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
444    * @return This object.
445    */
446   @FluentSetter
447   public PartList remove(List<NameValuePair> values) {
448      if (values != null)
449         values.forEach(this::remove);
450      return this;
451   }
452
453   /**
454    * Removes the part with the specified name from this list.
455    *
456    * @param name The part name.
457    * @return This object.
458    */
459   @FluentSetter
460   public PartList remove(String name) {
461      removeIf(x -> eq(x.getName(), name));
462      return this;
463   }
464
465   /**
466    * Removes the part with the specified name from this list.
467    *
468    * @param names The part name.
469    * @return This object.
470    */
471   @FluentSetter
472   public PartList remove(String...names) {
473      if (names != null)
474            for (String name : names)
475                remove(name);
476      return this;
477   }
478
479   /**
480    * Adds or replaces the part(s) with the same name.
481    *
482    * <p>
483    * If no part with the same name is found the given part is added to the end of the list.
484    *
485    * @param value The part to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
486    * @return This object.
487    */
488   @FluentSetter
489   public PartList set(NameValuePair value) {
490      if (value != null) {
491         boolean replaced = false;
492         for (int i = 0, j = size(); i < j; i++) {
493            NameValuePair x = get(i);
494            if (eq(x.getName(), value.getName())) {
495               if (replaced) {
496                  remove(i);
497                  j--;
498               } else {
499                  set(i, value);
500                  replaced = true;
501               }
502            }
503         }
504
505         if (! replaced)
506            add(value);
507      }
508
509      return this;
510   }
511
512   /**
513    * Adds or replaces the part(s) with the same name.
514    *
515    * <p>
516    * If no part with the same name is found the given part is added to the end of the list.
517    *
518    * @param values The part to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
519    * @return This object.
520    */
521   @FluentSetter
522   public PartList set(NameValuePair...values) {
523      if (values != null)
524         set(alist(values));
525      return this;
526   }
527
528   /**
529    * Replaces the first occurrence of the parts with the same name.
530    *
531    * @param name The part name.
532    * @param value The part value.
533    * @return This object.
534    */
535   public PartList set(String name, Object value) {
536      return set(createPart(name, value));
537   }
538
539   /**
540    * Replaces the first occurrence of the parts with the same name.
541    *
542    * @param name The part name.
543    * @param value The part value.
544    * @return This object.
545    */
546   public PartList set(String name, Supplier<?> value) {
547      return set(createPart(name, value));
548   }
549
550   /**
551    * Replaces the first occurrence of the parts with the same name.
552    *
553    * <p>
554    * If no part with the same name is found the given part is added to the end of the list.
555    *
556    * @param values The parts to replace.  <jk>null</jk> values are ignored.
557    * @return This object.
558    */
559   @FluentSetter
560   public PartList set(List<NameValuePair> values) {
561
562      if (values != null) {
563         for (NameValuePair h : values) {
564            if (h != null) {
565               for (int i2 = 0, j2 = size(); i2 < j2; i2++) {
566                  NameValuePair x = get(i2);
567                  if (eq(x.getName(), h.getName())) {
568                     remove(i2);
569                     j2--;
570                  }
571               }
572            }
573         }
574
575         for (NameValuePair x : values) {
576            if (x != null) {
577               add(x);
578            }
579         }
580      }
581
582      return this;
583   }
584
585   /**
586    * Gets the first part with the given name.
587    *
588    * <p>
589    * Part name comparison is case sensitive by default.
590    *
591    * @param name The part name.
592    * @return The first matching part, or {@link Optional#empty()} if not found.
593    */
594   public Optional<NameValuePair> getFirst(String name) {
595      for (int i = 0; i < size(); i++) {
596         NameValuePair x = get(i);
597         if (eq(x.getName(), name))
598            return Utils.opt(x);
599      }
600      return opte();
601   }
602
603   /**
604    * Gets the last part with the given name.
605    *
606    * <p>
607    * Part name comparison is case sensitive by default.
608    *
609    * @param name The part name.
610    * @return The last matching part, or {@link Optional#empty()} if not found.
611    */
612   public Optional<NameValuePair> getLast(String name) {
613      for (int i = size() - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
614         NameValuePair x = get(i);
615         if (eq(x.getName(), name))
616            return Utils.opt(x);
617      }
618      return opte();
619   }
620
621   /**
622    * Gets a part representing all of the part values with the given name.
623    *
624    * <p>
625    * If more that one part with the given name exists the values will be combined with <js>", "</js> as per
626    * <a href='https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-4.2'>RFC 2616 Section 4.2</a>.
627    *
628    * @param name The part name.
629    * @return A part with a condensed value, or {@link Optional#empty()} if no parts by the given name are present
630    */
631   public Optional<NameValuePair> get(String name) {
632
633      NameValuePair first = null;
634      List<NameValuePair> rest = null;
635      for (NameValuePair x : this) {
636         if (eq(x.getName(), name)) {
637            if (first == null)
638               first = x;
639            else {
640               if (rest == null)
641                  rest = Utils.list();
642               rest.add(x);
643            }
644         }
645      }
646
647      if (first == null)
648         return opte();
649
650      if (rest == null)
651         return Utils.opt(first);
652
653      CharArrayBuffer sb = new CharArrayBuffer(128);
654      sb.append(first.getValue());
655      for (NameValuePair element : rest) {
656         sb.append(',');
657         sb.append(element.getValue());
658      }
659
660      return Utils.opt(new BasicStringPart(name, sb.toString()));
661   }
662
663   /**
664    * Gets a part representing all of the part values with the given name.
665    *
666    * <p>
667    * If more that one part with the given name exists the values will be combined with <js>", "</js> as per
668    * <a href='https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-4.2'>RFC 2616 Section 4.2</a>.
669    *
670    * <p>
671    * The implementation class must have a public constructor taking in one of the following argument lists:
672    * <ul>
673    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>value</jv>)</c>
674    *    <li><c>X(Object <jv>value</jv>)</c>
675    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>name</jv>, String <jv>value</jv>)</c>
676    *    <li><c>X(String <jv>name</jv>, Object <jv>value</jv>)</c>
677    * </ul>
678    *
679    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
680    * <p class='bjava'>
681    *    BasicIntegerPart <jv>age</jv> = <jv>partList</jv>.get(<js>"age"</js>, BasicIntegerPart.<jk>class</jk>);
682    * </p>
683    *
684    * @param <T> The part implementation class.
685    * @param name The part name.
686    * @param type The part implementation class.
687    * @return A part with a condensed value or <jk>null</jk> if no parts by the given name are present
688    */
689   public <T> Optional<T> get(String name, Class<T> type) {
690
691      NameValuePair first = null;
692      List<NameValuePair> rest = null;
693      for (NameValuePair x : this) {
694         if (eq(x.getName(), name)) {
695            if (first == null)
696               first = x;
697            else {
698               if (rest == null)
699                  rest = Utils.list();
700               rest.add(x);
701            }
702         }
703      }
704
705      if (first == null)
706         return opte();
707
708      if (rest == null)
709         return opt(PartBeanMeta.of(type).construct(name, first.getValue()));
710
711      CharArrayBuffer sb = new CharArrayBuffer(128);
712      sb.append(first.getValue());
713      for (NameValuePair element : rest) {
714         sb.append(',');
715         sb.append(element.getValue());
716      }
717
718      return Utils.opt(PartBeanMeta.of(type).construct(name, sb.toString()));
719   }
720
721   /**
722    * Gets a part representing all of the part values with the given name.
723    *
724    * <p>
725    * Same as {@link #get(String, Class)} but the part name is pulled from the name or value attribute of the {@link FormData}/{@link Query}/{@link Path} annotation.
726    *
727    * <h5 class='figure'>Example</h5>
728    * <p class='bjava'>
729    *    Age <jv>age</jv> = <jv>partList</jv>.get(Age.<jk>class</jk>);
730    * </p>
731    *
732    * @param <T> The part implementation class.
733    * @param type The part implementation class.
734    * @return A part with a condensed value or <jk>null</jk> if no parts by the given name are present
735    */
736   public <T> Optional<T> get(Class<T> type) {
737      Utils.assertArgNotNull("type", type);
738
739      String name = PartBeanMeta.of(type).getSchema().getName();
740      Utils.assertArg(name != null, "Part name could not be found on bean type ''{0}''", type.getName());
741
742      return get(name, type);
743   }
744
745   /**
746    * Gets all of the parts.
747    *
748    * <p>
749    * The returned array maintains the relative order in which the parts were added.
750    * Each call creates a new array not backed by this list.
751    *
752    * <p>
753    * As a general rule, it's more efficient to use the other methods with consumers to
754    * get parts.
755    *
756    * @return An array containing all parts, never <jk>null</jk>.
757    */
758   public NameValuePair[] getAll() {
759      return stream().toArray(NameValuePair[]::new);
760   }
761
762   /**
763    * Gets all of the parts with the given name.
764    *
765    * <p>
766    * The returned array maintains the relative order in which the parts were added.
767    * Part name comparison is case sensitive by default.
768    * Parts with null values are ignored.
769    * Each call creates a new array not backed by this list.
770    *
771    * <p>
772    * As a general rule, it's more efficient to use the other methods with consumers to
773    * get parts.
774    *
775    * @param name The part name.
776    *
777    * @return An array containing all matching parts, never <jk>null</jk>.
778    */
779   public NameValuePair[] getAll(String name) {
780      return stream().filter(x -> eq(x.getName(), name)).toArray(NameValuePair[]::new);
781   }
782
783   /**
784    * Performs an action on the values for all matching parts in this list.
785    *
786    * @param filter A predicate to apply to each element to determine if it should be included.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
787    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
788    * @return This object.
789    */
790   public PartList forEachValue(Predicate<NameValuePair> filter, Consumer<String> action) {
791      return forEach(filter, x -> action.accept(x.getValue()));
792   }
793
794   /**
795    * Performs an action on the values of all matching parts in this list.
796    *
797    * @param name The part name.
798    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
799    * @return This object.
800    */
801   public PartList forEachValue(String name, Consumer<String> action) {
802      return forEach(name, x -> action.accept(x.getValue()));
803   }
804
805   /**
806    * Returns all the string values for all parts with the specified name.
807    *
808    * @param name The part name.
809    * @return An array containing all values.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
810    */
811   public String[] getValues(String name) {
812      return stream().filter(x -> eq(x.getName(), name)).map(NameValuePair::getValue).toArray(String[]::new);
813   }
814
815   /**
816    * Tests if parts with the given name are contained within this list.
817    *
818    * <p>
819    * Part name comparison is case insensitive.
820    *
821    * @param name The part name.
822    * @return <jk>true</jk> if at least one part with the name is present.
823    */
824   public boolean contains(String name) {
825      return stream().anyMatch(x -> eq(x.getName(), name));
826   }
827
828   /**
829    * Returns an iterator over this list of parts.
830    *
831    * @return A new iterator over this list of parts.
832    */
833   public PartIterator partIterator() {
834      return new BasicPartIterator(toArray(new NameValuePair[0]), null, caseInsensitive);
835   }
836
837   /**
838    * Returns an iterator over the parts with a given name in this list.
839    *
840    * @param name The name of the parts over which to iterate, or <jk>null</jk> for all parts
841    *
842    * @return A new iterator over the matching parts in this list.
843    */
844   public PartIterator partIterator(String name) {
845      return new BasicPartIterator(getAll(name), name, caseInsensitive);
846   }
847
848   /**
849    * Performs an action on all parts in this list with the specified name.
850    *
851    * <p>
852    * This is the preferred method for iterating over parts as it does not involve
853    * creation or copy of lists/arrays.
854    *
855    * @param name The parts name.
856    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
857    * @return This object.
858    */
859   public PartList forEach(String name, Consumer<NameValuePair> action) {
860      return forEach(x -> eq(name, x.getName()), action);
861   }
862
863   /**
864    * Performs an action on all the matching parts in this list.
865    *
866    * <p>
867    * This is the preferred method for iterating over parts as it does not involve
868    * creation or copy of lists/arrays.
869    *
870    * @param filter A predicate to apply to each element to determine if it should be included.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
871    * @param action An action to perform on each element.
872    * @return This object.
873    */
874   public PartList forEach(Predicate<NameValuePair> filter, Consumer<NameValuePair> action) {
875      forEach(x -> consume(filter, action, x));
876      return this;
877   }
878
879   /**
880    * Returns a stream of the parts in this list with the specified name.
881    *
882    * <p>
883    * This does not involve a copy of the underlying array of <c>NameValuePair</c> objects so should perform well.
884    *
885    * @param name The part name.
886    * @return This object.
887    */
888   public Stream<NameValuePair> stream(String name) {
889      return stream().filter(x->eq(name, x.getName()));
890   }
891
892   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
893   // Other methods
894   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
895
896   private NameValuePair createPart(String name, Object value) {
897      boolean isResolving = varResolver != null;
898
899      if (value instanceof Supplier<?>) {
900         Supplier<?> value2 = (Supplier<?>)value;
901         return isResolving ? new BasicPart(name, resolver(value2)) : new BasicPart(name, value2);
902      }
903      return isResolving ? new BasicPart(name, resolver(value)) : new BasicPart(name, value);
904   }
905
906   private Supplier<Object> resolver(Object input) {
907      return ()->varResolver.resolve(Utils.s(unwrap(input)));
908   }
909
910   private Object unwrap(Object o) {
911      while (o instanceof Supplier)
912         o = ((Supplier<?>)o).get();
913      return o;
914   }
915
916   private boolean eq(String s1, String s2) {
917      return caseInsensitive ? Utils.eqic(s1, s2) : Utils.eq(s1, s2);
918   }
919
920   /**
921    * Returns this list as a URL-encoded custom query.
922    */
923   @Override /* Object */
924   public String toString() {
925      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
926      forEach(p -> {
927         if (p != null) {
928            String v = p.getValue();
929            if (v != null) {
930               if (sb.length() > 0)
931                  sb.append("&");
932               sb.append(urlEncode(p.getName())).append('=').append(urlEncode(p.getValue()));
933            }
934         }
935      });
936      return sb.toString();
937   }

943      super.setUnmodifiable();
944      return this;
945   }
